The Chaos Giant is a dangerous entity created by the Red Axe and is currently the strongest giant in the game. It is a giant of unknown species, with a chaos device covering its head, neck, and part of its torso. Its left arm has barbed spikes, while its right arm has been mutated into three smaller arms carrying Dragon throwing axes.

Chaos Giants can be found at the end of the Barendir tunnels after completion of Birthright of the Dwarves. Ten chaos giants can be found in the cramped room.

Chaos Giants have a fairly decent drop table, and they can drop both their throwing axes and the dragon pickaxe. However, they drop the pickaxe at a rarer rate than the chaos dwarves on the battlefield while also taking longer to kill.

Locations[edit | edit source]

Location Levels Members Requirements Spawns Map
Barendir126None10Maplink

Strategy[edit | edit source]

The Chaos Giants are all aggressive. Therefore, players may use the rocks and crystals of the area to be safe from most ranged attacks while fighting only one giant.

When a Chaos Giant dies, another will immediately become aggressive. Occasionally, up to five Chaos Giants will become aggressive at once.

To reset the aggressiveness of the Chaos Giants, leave the cave and re-enter after about five seconds. Upon re-entering, only one Chaos Giant will be aggressive again.

Drops[edit | edit source]

Drop rates estimated based on 89,678 samples from the Drop Log Project, unless otherwise cited.

The average Chaos Giant kill is worth 23,441 coins.

Universal drops[edit | edit source]

Universal drops are dropped by nearly every monster and skilling action outside of Daemonheim.
These items are dropped alongside main drops.

Achievement[edit | edit source]

  • Slayer of Chaos ( 0) – Obtained a collection of unique drops from Slayer monsters located within Keldagrim.
    • Main and off-hand dragon throwing axe and dragon pickaxe drops

Update history[edit | edit source]

This information has been compiled as part of the update history project. Some updates may not be included – see here for how to help out!
  • ninja 11 April 2016 (Update):
    • Kuradal and Morvran now assign Chaos Giants to players that have completed Birthright of the Dwarves.
  • ninja 15 February 2016 (Update):
    • The drop table for chaos giants has been greatly improved, bringing it more in line with their requirements - including adding a very rare dragon pickaxe drop.
  • patch 5 October 2015 (Update):
    • Chaos giants now deal more than 1 damage with their melee attack.
  • patch 19 November 2013 (Update):
    • Chaos giants have had their drop tables rebalanced.
  • patch 15 October 2013 (Update):
    • Chaos giants no longer count as fire giants for Slayer tasks.
  • patch 8 October 2013 (Update):
    • Chaos Giants once again drop 8 off-hand dragon throwing axes instead of one.
  • update 2 October 2013 (Update):
    • Added to game.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Upon release, killing these would count towards fire giant slayer tasks. This was fixed in a silent patch within a week of release. On 11 April 2016, they became a separate category of their own, assigned by Kuradal and Morvran.
  • This is the first player-designed monster in Runescape.
  • On 19 November 2013 they received an overhaul to their drop table, removing most of the "junk" and replacing it with better items.
  • On 15 February 2016 the drop table got improved again, adding dragon pickaxe as a very rare drop. This drop is rarer than the 1/5,000 rate from the Chaos Dwarf Battlefield.[1]

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ a b Jagex. Mod Timbo's Twitter account. 26 November 2017. (Archived from the original on 27 January 2019.) Mod Timbo: "No, it is rarer from Chaos Giants than it is on the battlefield." In response to the question: "Wiki states the dragon pickaxe is a 1:5k drop rate...does this apply across the board to all monsters that drop it? Even the chaos giants?"
